verse.roman:
anyonya-śleṣayottuṅga-
nirantara-payodharām
sunāsāṁ sudvijāṁ snigdha-
hāsa-līlāvalokanām

synonyms: anyonya—to each other; śleṣayā—because of clinging; uttuṅga—raised; nirantara—without intervening space; payaḥ-dharām—breasts; su-nāsām—shapely nose; su-dvijām—beautiful teeth; snigdha—lovely; hāsa—smile; līlā-avalokanām—sportful glance.
translation: Her breasts projected upward because of their clinging to each other, and they were too contiguous to admit any intervening space. She had a shapely nose and beautiful teeth; a lovely smile played on her lips, and she cast a sportful glance at the asuras.
